node.title: PG&E to pay $55 million over old power lines sparking two major wildfires
node.description: The agreement enables the nation's largest utility to escape criminal prosecution for the mammoth blazes.

node.title: EPA to try to fight high gas prices at the pump with ethanol blend
node.description: It's the Biden administration's latest attempt to bring gas prices down for Americans.

node.title: Surprise find in cane at Boston's Logan airport: a long blade
node.description: The TSA said the man apparently had "no idea" the blade was present.

node.title: Businesses told to watch for staff burnout or face productivity drop
node.description: Businesses are being urged to change the way they control workload issues as more and more employees think about quitting as a result of Covid-19 related burnout.

node.title: NZ and French veterans' organisations sign MOU
node.description: The French and New Zealand organisations representing veterans of the armed services have agreed to help one another's members.

node.title: Personal data breach at defunct cryptocurrency trading site AlphaEx
node.description: The private information of 24 New Zealanders registered with a now defunct cryptocurrency trading site has been found on the dark web.

node.title: 'They are pretty enigmatic': Arnoux's beaked whales spotted in Antarctica
node.description: A group of researchers from New Zealand at Scott Base have had a rare sighting of Arnoux's beaked whales. Video

node.title: Dilworth abuse survivors back lawyer Frances Joychild QC to head inquiry
node.description: A leading human rights lawyer has been selected to lead the independent Inquiry into Historical Abuse at Dilworth School.

node.title: Grocery voucher offered for return of oximeters in MidCentral DHB
node.description: MidCentral District Health Board is offering a $20 grocery voucher to people who return its pulse oximeters.

node.title: 'Not a deterrent': Two-year jail term for Vake manslaughter criticised
node.description: Friends of a rising MMA fighter and father killed in a one punch attack want much tougher minimum sentences.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 11,063 new community cases and 16 further deaths
node.description: There are 11,063 new community cases of Covid-19 today and 16 further deaths to report.

node.title: Steel score comeback victory over Pulse
node.description: The Southern Steel have scored a stunning 66-63 comeback victory over the Pulse in Wellington.

node.title: Mt Ruapehu volcanic alert level stays raised as tremors continue
node.description: GNS Science says the sustained nature of volcanic unrest on Mount Ruapehu differs from those typically seen during the start of a heating phase and could indicate the possibility of an eruption.

node.title: 99% of Dunstan Downs to be preserved for conservation
node.description: The majority of high country station Dunstan Downs across Canterbury and Otago is set to be preserved for conservation.

node.title: Heavy rain to hit East Coast as Cyclone Fili approaches
node.description: MetService has upgraded its rain warning to red for the Wairoa District and Gisborne as Cyclone Fili closes in.

node.title: Black Ferns coach keeps job despite scathing review
node.description: Black Ferns coach Glenn Moore has been retained despite a scathing independent review into the team's culture and environment.

node.title: Retail and service sectors suffer in Omicron outbreak
node.description: Business confidence remains deeply pessimistic in the face of the Omicron outbreak, and surging inflation.

node.title: Man missing for three weeks found dead
node.description: A 64-year-old man recently reported missing on the West Coast, has been found dead.

node.title: Fau Vake attack: Man who pleaded guilty to manslaughter jailed
node.description: Daniel Havili, who pleaded guilty to the manslaughter of rising MMA fighter Fau Vake in a late night attack in Auckland has been jailed for two years and nine months.

node.title: Consumer spending trend 'concerning' amid high inflation
node.description: ASB Bank says consumers have been slow to adjust their spending habits to higher inflation, rising interest rates and less government stimulus.

node.title: Medical biotech researchers call for more govt funds
node.description: Medical researchers want government support for biotechnology, which offers life-saving treatments as well as significant economic gains for New Zealand.

node.title: Hundreds more dairy, meat and forestry workers allowed in under new border rules
node.description: The government has announced exceptions allowing 1580 more workers to come to New Zealand for jobs in the dairy, meat processing and forestry industries. Audio

node.title: Russian ambassador continues refusing 'futile' briefings
node.description: Russian Ambassador Georgii Zuev has continued to decline to either appear before select committees, or to be interviewed by media, saying that would be futile.

node.title: CMT Music Awards 2022: Complete list of winners and nominees
node.description: Co-host Kane Brown came into the night with the most nominations of anybody with four.

node.title: Cell tower sales may pay off for consumers
node.description: The possible sale of cellular telecommunications towers by the two biggest network owners could lead to cheaper services for consumers over the longer term.

node.title: Police recover more than $200k of stolen property in Whangārei raid
node.description: Northland police have recovered $200,000 in stolen property after a raid on a Whangārei property.

node.title: Alabama law banning transgender medication challenged in two lawsuits
node.description: The law makes it a crime​ for doctors to treat trans youth under 19 with puberty blockers or hormones to help affirm their gender identity.

node.title: NZTA taking control of NZ's supply of bitumen for roading
node.description: Almost all road building bitumen is being taken over by the Transport Agency, which believes it's being ripped off by suppliers.

node.title: Jury convicts former police officer on 6 counts related to January 6
node.description: Thomas Robertson was found guilty Monday on all charges, including obstructing officers during the Capitol riot.

node.title: Northland local government leadership faces seismic leadership change
node.description: Northland local government is facing its biggest leadership change this year.
